TopicTitle: MÃƒÂ¼n moved a few metres away from Kerbin

Articles.Content:
Hello there, i've been lurking on these forums for a while, for inspiration and updates, and i thought it was time for my introduction. I've been doing KSP for a couple of years occasionally, and i've darted so many crashers into MÃƒÂ¼n that i've nudged it a couple metres away. No Kerbals were hurt, most of them died instantly and the rest got oxygen deprived.

My stats; 28 yo, industrial mechanical operator, rigged to play ksp pretty well (Intel i5 4670k + msi 770GTX)

My goal is to beat North Korea's record time to physically land a person on the Sun, and then return him home safely.

Aaa, if only that was possible

btw, it's Mun, not MÃƒÂ¼n

Welcome back!

How many meters have you moved the Mun, though? xD
You can not move the Mun, or any plnaetary body. They're "on-rails". You also can not land on the sun.

You also can not land on the sun.

If North Korea can, we can too.

I made one of the great dark craters because the lander carried a ton of unused RCS fuel And i didn't push the Mun, it decided for itself to move away because it doesn't want to get infected with those Kerbals. That's why it keeps swatting my low orbit satellites out of the sky with it's mountains. And North Koreans go to camps where they learn to concentrate, that's how they could land on the sun and fly back within 24 hours!

Edited March 27, 2014 by Grimfilth
